intro: Crambe dionysopolysi, commonly known as the Dionysopolis crambe, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by elongated, pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, typical of many members of its family. Crambe dionysopolysi is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments.
